translation.resume.narration: Welcome back! Do you want to continue your life from where you last left off?
translation.start.narration: Welcome to Life! In this game, you will be given choices to make in your new virtual life! Would you like to play?
translation.stop.narration: Thanks for playing! Come back later to experience another life!
translation.opener.narration: Congratulations!! You've just graduated from Average Town High School. Now you need to decide what to do with your life going forward. Here are your options for what to do next. You can go to a Trade School, a Public College, a Private College, or Party School. Which would you like to do?
translation.party.narration: The party school it is. There are many frats and sororities that you can become a part of. This type of college is great for having fun. Even though it is considered a party school you still need to figure out what field you would like to study in.
translation.trade.narration: You have chosen to go to trade school! You decided that college life wasn't for you and wanted to get a head start on life.
translation.finished_trade.narration: Congrats! You have finished up your short experience at trade school and now have valuable skill sets that you can use in the workforce! Now it is time to figure out which job you want to do.
translation.private.narration: You have chosen a private college! You value your education and want to get the best possible outcome from college. With smaller classroom sizes and fewer student populations, you will be able to get the most out of your educational experience.
translation.public.narration: You have chosen a public college! Alright! Public colleges are the best of both worlds. Many people choose public universities because they want the full college experience of getting a degree while still being able to party at the same time.
translation.choosemajor.narration: Would you like to study science or art?
translation.sciences.narration: You chose to study the sciences.
translation.arts.narration: You chose to study the arts.
translation.collegelife.narration: Your first two years you work on getting all your general education done with. You need to decide how you wanted to spend your time while at college. You could go out and party, focus on your studies or try to do both. How do you want to spend your time in college?
translation.both_life.narration: You chose to try and do both! You figure that you've put in the hard work and that hard work deserves a little bit of a reward. You party but not too hard because you know there is still work to be done to finish out your degree.
translation.study_life.narration: You chose to study! You have decided that studying and getting good grades is worth your time, because of the money you are spending.
translation.party_life.narration: You chose to party! You become one of the most well-known party animals on campus. You've definitely earned your degree in Partying, although... that does not count for much in the real world.
translation.workstudy.narration: You get tired of having no money to spend on things you want and having to rely on your parents to pay for things. A job opportunity on campus appears and you think it might be a good way to make some extra cash. Would you like to work while in college?
translation.workstudy_yes.narration: You chose to work at college. The rest of your time not learning at school you spend working. This allows you to save up some money to pay off your Schooling. You get out of college with great experience and are ready to get out there in the real world.
translation.workstudy_no.narration: You know having a job would help you make some extra cash to pay for things and college. However, you think that focusing on your studies is more important right now. You choose not to work at college...
translation.graduatedcollege.narration: Congrats! You've made your way through the exciting and stressful thing they call college. Now, it's on to the real world and you can't live in the dorms anymore.
translation.wheretolive.narration: Freshly out of college and ready to take on a new chapter in life, you have to decide where you would like to live. Your loving parents have offered you your old room temporarily until you can get some money saved up to get a place of your own. Or, you can continue to live away from home and find an apartment somewhere to get some independence. Which would you like to do? Live in your old room or rent an apartment?
translation.parents_house.narration: You are living in your parents' basement. It's not as great as it was when you were a kid and you want to get out of there fast. So you need to find a job if you want to move out.
translation.apartment.narration: You are living in your own apartment. Welcome to true independence!
translation.choosejob.narration: Time to find a job. What job do you want?
translation.sciencejobs.narration: You chose to get a degree in science so you can choose the following jobs: Programmer, Doctor, Forensic scientist. Which will it be?
translation.artjobs.narration: You chose to get a degree in the arts, so you can choose the following jobs: Teacher, Writer, or a Designer. Which will it be?
translation.tradejobs.narration: You chose to get a degree in a trade so you can choose the following jobs: Contractor, Auto Mechanic, or an Electrician. Which will it be?
translation.programmer.narration: You become a programmer. You enjoy problem sovling and writing programs that can complete daily tasks for you.
translation.doctor.narration: You chose to become a doctor. Nothing brings you more satisfaction than helping save lives and protecting the good people in the community around you.
translation.forensic_scientist.narration: Wanting to help find criminals you became a forensic scientist. Using your abilities to analyze evidence to use in determining the innocence or guilt of a suspect.
translation.teacher.narration: Being with kids and helping them learn is a passion of yours. You took your passion and are now a teacher.
translation.writer.narration: Writing your own stories to tell a compelling peice is amazing. You took your skills and used them to become a writer.
translation.designer.narration: You decided on being a designer. Making creative work and displaying it for people to see.
translation.construction.narration: You are a contractor now. Using math and physics to create wonderful buildings.
translation.auto_mechanic.narration: Fixing cars and getting old ones to work again is something fantastic. You choose to become an auto mechanic
translation.electrician.narration: Running wire through a house and getting power to everything is phenomenal. You became a electrician
translation.chooseresidents.narration: You can finally afford a place of your own! Now where to live? You've narrowed it down to three locations: out in the beautiful countryside, right in the busy city, or just outside the city in a cozy suburban home. Which will it be? The city, the suburbs, or the country?
translation.country.narration: You love the wide-open outdoors with no traffic, few neighbors, and plenty of room for activities. The country is where you want to live.
translation.city.narration: You enjoy the hustle and bustle of the City. There are many things to do and go see in the city, that is why you wanted to live there
translation.suburb.narration: After looking at all the different places to live you decided being in a safe and cozy suburb would be great for you.
translation.retirement_fund.narration: Now that you are finally all settled in, would you like to set up a retirement fund to help yourself in the future? This will require monthly contributions.
translation.retirement_fund_yes.narration: You decide to look out for your future self and invest in a retirement plan that will work for you.
translation.retirement_fund_no.narration: You decide that you need to look out for your current self first. Retirement is a long way away!
translation.dating.narration: You've met a cute partner whom you deem suitable for companionship during the night on the town. You two hit it off immediately and decide to begin dating.
translation.marriage.narration: You and your partner have been going strong for a while now and you begin to think about asking them to marry you. Will you propose?
translation.rejection.narration: OUCH! That one hurt. Your partner was clearly not ready for marriage. The rejection has fractured your relationship and you both decide to go separate ways.
translation.alone.narration: Wow, that break up really took a toll on you, huh? You've spent years following the break up alone in isolation with your thoughts and feelings. Maybe a pet would cheer you up. Would you like to adopt a pet?
translation.married.narration: Congratulations! You are getting married to the love of your life. Is the wedding going to be big or small?
translation.single.narration: You figured that getting married would be a waste of your time and you are better off alone. All you need is your work and yourself to be content in life. Though you may feel that you need an animal companion.
translation.adoption_q.narration: Would you like to adopt a pet?
translation.big.narration: You want to have a big wedding with lots of people, food, and decorations. The wedding went great. You invited all your family and friends to celebrate the occasion.
translation.small.narration: You only wanted to have a few people at your wedding and not many decorations to keep the cost down.
translation.adoption.narration: So, you've decided to get yourself a little companion to keep you company? We think these three might be the best options for you. There's a Dog, a Cat, or a quiet little fish. Which would you like?
translation.dog.narration: You've chosen to adopt a dog! This furry, loveable, and energetic fella will enjoy your company. Dogs require a lot of attention and love but they can also be your best friend. Treat them well!
translation.cat.narration: This furry little creature will bring you lots of love and joy but can be quite a handful at times. They will always be around for you though when you need someone to snuggle up with through the hard times.
translation.fish.narration: You've chosen to be a fish owner! Great! These little aquatic animals do not require as much attention as the other options but will be an intriguing pet. They may not do much but it is always enjoyable to sit in their company and watch them in their own world.
translation.married_life.narration: Now that you have been married for some time and life is going well are kids something you would like to have?
translation.kids1.narration: You and your partner had a kid! Congrats!
translation.kids2.narration: You and your partner had twins! Twice as much fun!
translation.kids3.narration: What luck! You and your partner had triplets! A triple threat!
translation.retire_choice.narration: You're starting to age and you notice you have been more fatigued from work than normal. Maybe you should just retire and enjoy your time and do some activities you like. Will you retire?
translation.retire.narration: After a great long time at your job, you decide to retire from work. You can now spend the rest of your life doing things you enjoy.
translation.dontretire.narration: You enjoy your job too much and don't know if you would ever stop working in life. You continue the rest of your life working with, just with fewer hours.
translation.scenario2.narration: You have now moved into your new place but you soon discover that your new living space needs repairs. That's gonna hurt the wallet!
translation.scenario1.narration: You were at a party and fell off a roof and broke your back! You had to be transported by ambulance to the hospital
translation.scenario3.narration: Your hard work has finally paid off! Your boss has decided to give you a raise after all the time and effort you have put in!
translation.scenario4.narration: Uh Oh! Looks like your kids have outgrown their current bedset in their room and they need a new one! This will cost some money...
translation.ending.narration: Thank you for playing life simulator, here is a quick overview of your life...
translation.money_good.narration: You did a good job balancing the budget and were able to be free of debt! Congrats!...
translation.money_bad.narration: You didn't do a great job balancing the budget and left your family with some debt...
translation.character_good.narration: You turned out to be a great person that people really enjoyed being around!...
translation.character_bad.narration: You weren't the most sociable person but you were great friends with the couple people who were able to get past that...
translation.stress_good.narration: You didn't have a very stressful life which is very rare in today's world!...
translation.stress_bad.narration: You had a pretty stressful life though many would say it was worth it!...
translation.married_true.narration: You got married to your best friend
translation.kids_3.narration: and had three kids! That's a busy house!...
translation.married_false.narration: You decided to live the single life and enjoyed it!...
translation.married_heartbroken.narration: Unfortunately, the love of your life left you...
translation.pet_yes.narration: You got a {pet} to keep you company!...
translation.pet_no.narration: You decided not to get a pet...
translation.retired_yes.narration: You retired though you didn't set up a retirement fund so you weren't able to do everything you were hoping you could do...
translation.retired_yes_fund.narration: You retired and because of the retirement fund, you set up you were able to do everything you were hoping to do!...
translation.retired_no_fund.narration: You decided not to retire so you used the money in your old savings account you set up years ago to help fund your kid's college education...
translation.the_end_good.narration: You had a great life and you should be proud!...
translation.the_end_bad.narration: Your life may not have been ideal but it was yours and that's something to be proud about!...
translation.play_again.narration: Would you like to play again?
